creditline: The Linda and Lawrence Perlman Photography Endowment
description: round image; white margin; portrait of a black man wearing a black jacket, white shirt and green paisley bow tie and vest which match background; man holds a yellow whistle on a yellow cord in his PL hand; certificate of authenticity in object file in Registration
image_copyright: © Omar Victor Diop%2C Courtesy MAGNIN-A%2C Paris
medium: Pigment inkjet printing on Harman By Hahnemüle paper mounted on aluminum
text: Senegalese photographer Omar Victor Diop is a self-taught artist who draws inspiration for his work from celebrated figures within the African diaspora. Through cinematically composed portrayals of himself in both individual and group portraits, he occupies the position of saints, martyrs, and leaders from a global Black community, conveying its heroism in truly epic style. Were it not for a telltale soccer ball or plastic whistle, one would almost believe his work to be a historic print.
title: Frédérick Douglass
